gurmukhi: jdubIr mhw rnDIr jbY suDvwie pry rQ ieau kih kY ] bl d`Cn Er inhwr ikqo dl DwXo hY SsqR sBY gih kY ]
transliteration: Jadoubeer Mahaa Randheer Jabai Dudhvaae Dare Rath Io Kah(i) Kai|| Bal Dachchhan Or Nihaar Kito Dal Dhaayo Hai Shastra Sabhai Gadh Kai||
translation: Getting his chariot driven, Krishna moved away saying this, “Look, Balram! the enemy’s army is marching forward enormously from the South;”

gurmukhi: bqIXw suin so biRj nwiek kI hl so bil Dwie lIey cihkY ] iqh ko Aiq sRon pirE BUA mY mno swrsuqI su clI bih kY ]1791]
transliteration: Bateeyaa Soun(i) So Brij Naaik Kihal So Bal(i) Dhaae Leee Chaihkai|| Tih Ko At(i) Sron Pario Bhooa Mai Mano Saarsoutisu Chalibaih Kai||1791||
translation: Listening to the words of Krishna, Balram carrying his plough in great zeal, marched towards that side and so much blood of that army flowed that the Saraswati seemed flow on the earth.1791.

gurmukhi: eyk inhwr BXo Aiq Awhv sXwm BnY qij kY rn Bwgy ] Gwiel GUmq eyk iPrY mno nId GnI ins ky khUM jwgy ]
transliteration: Ek Nihaar Bhayo At(i) Aahav Syaam Bhanai Taj(i) Kai Ran Bhaage|| Ghaail Ghoomat Ek Phirai Mano Need Ghaninis Ke Kahoon Jaage||
translation: Many warriors seeing the dreadfulness of war, fled away; many of them getting wounded and weak are roaming many of them getting wounded and wak are roaming like the ones having kept awake for several nights;

gurmukhi: paurKvMq bfy Bt eyk su sXwm so ju`D hI kau Anurwgy ] eyk qXwg kY SsqR sBY jdurwie ky Awie kY pwien lwgy ]1792]
transliteration: Paurakhvant Bade Bhat Ek Su Syaam So Juddh Hikau Anuraage|| Ek Tyaag Kai Shastra Sabhai Jaduraae Ke Aae Kai Paain Laage||1792||
translation: Many great warriors and masters of great strength are absorbed only on fighting with Krishna and many, abandoning their weapons have fallen at the feet of Krishna.1792.

gurmukhi: Bjy S`qR jb ju`D qy mn mY qRws bFwie ] Aaur sUr Awvq Bey krvwrn cmkwie ]1793]
transliteration: Bhaje Shatttra Jab Juddh Te Man Mai Traas Badhaae|| Aur Soor Aavat Bhae Karvaaran Chamkaae||1793||
translation: When, becoming fearful, the enemies ran away, many other warriors reached there, gleaming their swords.1793.

gurmukhi: SsqR sMBwr sBY Bt Awie kY Dwie kY sXwm su ju`Du mcwXo ] c`kR gihE kr mY biRjnwiek kop BXo iqh aUpr DwXo ]
transliteration: Shastra Sanbhaar Sabhai Bhat Aae Kai Dhaae Kai Syaam Su Juddh(u) Machadyo|| Chakkra Gadio Mar Mai Brijnaaik Kop Bhayo Tih Oopar Dhaayo||
translation: Holding their weapons, the enemies fell upon Krishna and on this side, Krishna taking his discus in his hand, ran towards them;

gurmukhi: bIr kIey ibn pRwn Gny Ar sYn sBY ieh BwNiq BjwXo ] paun pRcMf smwn su kwnH mno aumifE dlu myG aufwXo ]1794]
transliteration: Beer Bin Praan Ghane Ar Sain Sabhai Eh Bhaan(i) Bhajaayo|| Paoun Prachanndd Samaan Su Kaahn Mano Oumdio Dalu Megh Udaayo||1794||
translation: He killed many warriors and caused the enemy’s army to flee like the violent Krihsna-wind had caused clouds to fly away.1794.

gurmukhi: kwtq eykn ky isr c`kR gdw gih dUjn ky qn Jwry ] qIjn nYn idKwie igrwvq cauQn cOp cpytn mwry ]
transliteration: Kaatat Ekan Ke Sir Chakkra Gadaa Gadh Doojan Ke Tan Jhdare|| Tijan Nain Dikhaae Giraavat Chaouthan Chaoup Chapetan Maarre||
translation: Krishna is chopping the head of someone with his discus and striking blows with his mace on the body of another; he is causing the third one to fall down by showing him the outrageous eyes; and the fourth is being killed with the slap of his blow;

gurmukhi: cIr dey Ar aur sRI hir sUrn ky AMg AMg pHwry ] DIr qhwN Bt kaun DrY jdubIr jbY iqh Er isDwry ]1795]
transliteration: Cheer Dae Ar Ur Srihar(i) Sooran Ke An An Prahdare|| Dheer Tahaan Bhat Kaoun Ddarai Jadoubeer Jabai Tih Or Sidhdare||1795||
translation: By inflicting blows on the limbs of warriors, Krishna has ripped their hearts; in any direction, wherever he goes, the power of endurance of all the warriors is lost.1795.

gurmukhi: ros BrXo jbhI biRj nwiek du`jn sYn inhwr prY ] qumhU DO ibcwr kho icq mY jg kaun bIE Bt DIr DrY ]
transliteration: Ros Bdaryo Jab-hibrij Naaik Dujjan Sain Neehaar Darai|| Toumhoo Dhau Bichaar Kaho Chit Mai Jag Kaoun Beeo Bhat Dheer Ddarai||
translation: When the hero of Braja looks towards the enemy’s army angrily, then you can tell thoughtfully as to who is the other such warrior, who can keep his power of endurance;
